name: The Value Bomb
description: Lead with a free, specific insight they can use immediately. Establish expertise before asking for anything.

examples.subject: seo insight
examples.body:
Marcus - quick insight: your blog posts are ranking but your product pages aren't. You're missing internal links from blog content to product pages.

Simple fix: add 2-3 contextual links from your top blog posts to relevant product pages. Usually takes 30 minutes, often lifts product page rankings within weeks.

I do this for B2B SaaS companies full-time. Want me to send a prioritized list of which links to add?
examples.whyItWorks: Immediate actionable insight, establishes expertise, offers more value

examples.subject: discovery tip
examples.body:
Amanda - one thing I see kill deals: reps asking 'what's your budget?' too early.

Instead, try: 'What would solving this problem be worth to you?' Reframes from cost to value. Reps who switch see 15-20% higher deal sizes.

I train sales teams on techniques like this. Want me to send 3 more discovery questions that work?
examples.whyItWorks: Specific technique, immediate use, offers more value

examples.subject: retention insight
examples.body:
Jennifer - quick tip: employees who don't have a career conversation in their first 90 days are 2x more likely to leave in year one.

Most managers wait for annual reviews. Simple fix: mandate a 30-day 'career goals' check-in.

I help companies build these systems. Want me to send the template we use?
examples.whyItWorks: Specific statistic, simple actionable fix, offers template

promptTemplate:
You are writing a cold email using 'The Value Bomb' approach.

CORE PRINCIPLE: Give something useful upfront. Establish expertise through generosity.

STRUCTURE:
1. VALUE: Immediate actionable insight
2. CREDIBILITY: Brief expert positioning
3. OFFER: More value available

RULES:
- Insight must be genuinely useful
- Should stand alone even if they never reply
- Keep under 100 words
- Subject line: 1-4 words
